properties.areaDesc: Crawford, MO; Franklin, MO; Jefferson, MO; St. Louis City, MO; St. Charles, MO; St. Louis, MO; Washington, MO
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:49PM CST until January 11 at 7:45AM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
St. Louis City in east central Missouri...
Northeastern St. Charles County in east central Missouri...
Crawford County in east central Missouri...
Jefferson County in east central Missouri...
Washington County in east central Missouri...
Southeastern Franklin County in east central Missouri...
St. Louis County in east central Missouri...

* Until 745 AM CST Saturday.

* At 1048 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain which will cause flooding. Up to three inches of rain
have already fallen.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
St. Louis, St. Charles, Florissant, Chesterfield, Wildwood,
University City, Ballwin, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood,
Webster Groves, Ferguson, Arnold, Manchester, Creve Coeur,
Overland, Clayton, Cahokia, Jennings and St. Ann.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 203 and 218, and between
exits 257 and 277.
Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 185 and 191.
Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 229 and 231.

This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Washington State Park,
Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Onondaga Cave State
Park, Castlewood State Park, Confluence State Park, Mastodon Historic
Site, Dillard Mill Historic Site, Sandy Creek Covered Bridge Historic
Site, First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site, Robertsville State
Park, and Meramec State Park.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.
